result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Emily Minerva Smith not in court, in custody at SCDC.  Attorney George Andrew Limbeck appeared by phone for Emily Minerva Smith. 
Deft continues to refuse to come to the phone for her Court appearances. 
Court rcvd & reviewed competency report; Deft not competent to proceed but likely to regain. 
Attorney Limbeck not contesting findings of report.
Court finds deft not competent but likely to become competent, finds probable cause & suspends proceedings.
Deft committed to DHS. Court orders involuntary administration of medication and reviews days credit.
950/Marsy's Law complied with.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Limbeck is appointed as counsel.
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate of $100 per month until total sum is paid.
The first payment shall be made on 10/01/2022.  
Failure to make payment on the schedule as established above shall result in the remaining balance becoming immediately due. Sheboygan County through its Corporation Counsel, may initiate a lawsuit or other collection action against you to collect the amount due, together with costs.
The attorney shall be compensated at $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court. To receive payment, bill must be submitted within 90 days of withdrawal or case disposition.
Copy to DE at SCDC
Atty. Limbeck
